pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:0.5: 25. The training rule on borrowed robes
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.2: there was a nun who, after walking for almsfood, spread out her moist robe and entered her dwelling.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.3: A second nun put on that robe and went to the village for alms.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.4: Soon afterwards the first nun came out and asked the nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.6: The nuns told her what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.7: She then complained and criticized the second nun,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.8: “How could a nun put on my robe without asking permission?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.9: She told the nuns what had happened,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.10: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.11: “How could a nun put on another nun’s robe without asking permission?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.12: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.17: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.18.1: ‘If a nun wears a robe taken on loan, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.1.6: if she wears any of the five robes belonging to a fully ordained nun, and it has not been given to her, nor has she asked permission to use it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.1: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.4: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.5: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.6: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.7: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.2: if the robe has been given to her;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.3: if she wears it after asking permission;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.4: if her own robe has been stolen;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.5: if her own robe has been lost;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.8: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.9: The fifth training rule is finished.
